p:
The Hancioglu Model has three organizations ( Figure 12b):
The smallest one is
O 1
H c g
, which contains all the species responsible for the immune response.
O 1
H c g
is a subset of
O 2
H c g
, which additionally contains species H and R, representing the healthy organism without infection but with the immune response turned on.
O 3
H c g
is the “full” organization containing all the species of the models and thus representing the organism with infection and immune response.
Thus, all the organizations represent meaningful states of the organism. However, there is no organization that only consists of healthy cells without any infection and immune response. Note that almost all the previous models except for Hernandez have such an organization.
